summary:
• Shackleton's Endurance ship gets extra protection
• The ship is being protected to preserve its historical significance 
• The goal is to preserve it for future generations

• Teen jumps from jet ski to stop runaway boat.
• Koala sanctuary stops allowing hugs due to animal welfare concerns.

• Brazil's President Jair Bolsonaro might face charges related to a jewelry transaction.
• The exact nature of these charges remains unclear at this time.
• No further details have been released about the incident or potential consequences for Bolsonaro.

• Canada has become the "car theft capital of the world" due to lax laws and lenient sentences.
• The country is under scrutiny at the NATO summit for allegedly free-riding on other countries' defense efforts.
• Canada's inaction on climate change and human rights issues contributes to its international reputation as an unreliable partner.

• Heatwaves and floods in China increase awareness about climate change.
• The country experiences extreme weather conditions due to global warming.
• Climate change is recognized as an urgent issue by the Chinese government and citizens alike.

• Copenhagen offers free coffee to tourists as part of its sustainable tourism initiative.
• The city aims to reduce waste and promote eco-friendly practices through this program.
• By providing free coffee, Copenhagen hopes to attract visitors while minimizing environmental impact.

• The French Socialist party is eyeing the Prime Minister position despite ongoing political deadlock.
• The recent French election resulted in a surprise outcome due to various factors.
• A left-leaning coalition has emerged as a dominant force in French politics following the election results.

• Iran's new president will prioritize domestic development over international relations.
• The president aims to reduce Iran's dependence on oil exports by increasing non-oil revenue.
• The administration plans to implement policies that benefit the middle class, including increased subsidies and job creation initiatives.

• The Irish Prime Minister is set to intervene on behalf of an Irish woman who faces charges in Dubai.
• This move aims to ensure her safety and secure fair treatment during the legal proceedings.
• The intervention may also facilitate communication between authorities to resolve the matter efficiently.

• Health care in Gaza City is collapsing due to an Israeli offensive.
• The crisis has forced thousands to flee their homes.
• A new Israeli operation in Gaza City is underway.

• South Korean politician blames women for rising male suicides.
• Gautam Gambhir has transitioned from being an aggressive batsman to becoming a strategic coach.
• A South Korean politician has made controversial remarks about men committing suicide due to women.

• Protesters in Barcelona used water guns to attack tourists.
• The protest was sparked by frustration towards tourists.
• The incident highlights tensions between locals and visitors in popular tourist destinations.

• A Kyiv hospital was attacked by missiles.
• The US will be providing more air defenses to protect against such attacks.
• The attack resulted in the deaths of 37 people, including children.

• Donald Trump has challenged Joe Biden to a debate without moderators.
• The US has discovered an alleged Russian "bot farm".
• A New York bridge is stuck open due to extreme heat.
